ARABIC: وَلَقَدْ نَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ يَضِيقُ صَدْرُكَ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We know that your breast is constricted by what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We are well aware that you are disheartened by what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We certainly know that their statements sorely grieve you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We certainly know that you feel sad about what they say against you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And indeed We know that you are disheartened by their speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Indeed, We know that your breast becomes tight because of what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And surely We know that your breast straitens at what they say;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We know indeed thy breast is straitened by the things they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Well know We that thy bosom is oppressed by what they say,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We do indeed know how your heart is distressed at what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And assuredly We know that thou straitenest thy breast by that which they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Certainly We know that you become upset because of what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We do indeed know how thy heart is distressed at what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Indeed, We know that your breast is straitened at what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, We know your chest is straitened by that they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We are aware that your heart is strained by what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [15:97] And verily (wa-laqad is for confirmation) We know that your breast is [at times] oppressed by what they say, in the way of mockery and denial.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Well know We that thy bosom) Muhammad (is at times oppressed by what they say) in their denial of you, and that you are a poet, a magician, a liar and a diviner,
